description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Amer Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Amer Awaits

places.generalDescription: Amber Palace, also known as Amer Fort, is a stunning architectural marvel located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. This magnificent fort showcases a blend of Hindu and Muslim design elements, making it a unique cultural landmark. Visitors can enjoy elephant rides that add to the enchanting experience of exploring this historical site. The fort's intricate structures are built from various colored stones‚Äîmilk white, light yellow, rose red, and pure white‚Äîwhich give it an amber-like appearance from afar.

sources.snippet: Amber fort, also known as Amber Palace boasts of an artistic grandeur and structural expertise. It is a reminiscent of the bravery and courage of the mighty Rajputs, who had played a remarkable role in the history of medieval India.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text:
Amber Fort is one of those places that leaves you awestruck the moment you see it........Huge, majestic, and full of history, it easily takes 2‚Äì3 hours to explore........though you'll hardly notice the time passing. The Sheesh Mahal is simply magical........the tiny mirrors sparkle beautifully, even in the faintest light.
I'd highly recommend taking a local guide........they share fascinating stories, little-known facts, and bring the fort's past to life in a way that signboards never can. The architecture is stunning........with a perfect blend of Rajput charm and Mughal elegance, and the views of Maota Lake from the top are picture-perfect.
If you can........arrive early to enjoy the elephant ride up to the fort........it's a unique, royal touch to the experience. For a different vibe........there's also a light and sound show in the evening that tells the fort's history beautifully.
Amber Fort isn't just a sightseeing spot........it's a walk through Rajasthan's glorious past........and honestly........it's one of Jaipur's must-visits.

Amber Fort is a beautiful place to visit in Jaipur. The architecture is amazing and the views from the top are stunning. The fort is quite big, so it's worth taking some time to explore. It can get busy, but overall it's a great experience and a highlight of Jaipur.

And I also strongly suggest to hire a guide to dive even deeper into the history of Amber Palace / Fort.

Very very excited to visit here... Great place... And it is biggest fort I have ever seen. Must go... Jaipur is very beautiful city lots of historic Places are there. But make sure u have at least 5 hours to visit this fort... And inside the fort thare is nothing to eat so make sure your tummy is full before go inside.

places.generalDescription: Amer Fort, located in Jaipur, Rajasthan, is complemented by the nearby Jaigarh Fort. Offering breathtaking panoramic views of Amer Fort and its surroundings, Jaigarh Fort provides visitors with stunning vistas of the fort complex, Maota Lake, and the rugged Aravalli hills. This historical site boasts remarkable architecture and holds significant historical value. Visitors can expect to spend around 3-4 hours exploring this well-maintained and historically rich location.

sources.snippet: Among the numerous forts that they built the Amer Fort is one of the most magnificent. The fort is located on the Aravalli Range, which acts as a protective shield to the outer structure of the fort. Located strategically on a forested hilltop (Cheel ka Teel -the hill of the eagles), it is also known as Amer ka Qila.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

sources.snippet: When we talk about Jaipur then it is not possible that we could ignore the Amer fort. It is undoubtedly the most beautiful fort and the pride of Jaipur!!. Amber fort, also known as Amber Palace boasts of an artistic grandeur and structural expertise.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text:
Amber Fort is a beautiful place to visit in Jaipur. The architecture is amazing and the views from the top are stunning. The fort is quite big, so it's worth taking some time to explore. It can get busy, but overall it's a great experience and a highlight of Jaipur.

And I also strongly suggest to hire a guide to dive even deeper into the history of Amber Palace / Fort.

Amber Fort is a beautiful and historic monument that truly showcases the rich heritage of Jaipur. The fort is well maintained overall, and the architecture and views are absolutely stunning, making it a must-visit for tourists. However, there is still room for improvement when it comes to cleanliness. A little more attention to hygiene and upkeep in certain areas would make the experience even better.

If you are visiting Jaipur never miss to visit this place.It is one of the most iconic and famous structures in the city of Jaipur. Visitors can enjoy the beauty of the fort, and can also experience an elephant ride to reach the palace entrance.The palace is perched on a hill overlooking Maota Lake, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

places.generalDescription: Nahargarh Fort, built in 1734 above Jaipur, is part of a trio of forts along with Jaigarh and Amer. It was constructed to protect the city and has a rich military history. The fort also houses a wax museum featuring sports stars, freedom fighters, and Bollywood celebrities. Visitors can embark on a cycling expedition to explore the fort in a unique way while enjoying stunning views of Jaipur and Man Sagar Lake.

sources.shortName: Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

places.name: Nahargarh Fort

reviews.text: Nahargarh Fort is one of the best places to visit in Jaipur especially if you enjoy nature and views. The fort is easily reachable by bike with a smooth road and a short ride through scenic hills. The views from the top are just stunning especially during sunset when you can see the whole city of Jaipur. The fort itself has beautiful old architecture and a peaceful vibe. There are a few cafes inside to relax and enjoy snacks. The area is clean and well maintained

A must visit place in Jaipur. You can drive your car up to the top of the hill to reach this fort. Road in good but in the end very narrow. Parking is available near fort. From roof top of this fort, you get best view of entire Jaipur city. Amazing place.

Visited Nahargarh Fort recently and had a great time. The entry ticket is very reasonably priced at just ‚Çπ52 per person. The fort is open from 9:00 AM to 9:30 PM, giving you plenty of time to explore at your own pace.

We booked our own bike to get there - cost about ‚Çπ50 for parking, which is also fair considering the location and security.

The views from the top are absolutely stunning, especially during sunset. The fort itself is well-maintained and offers a mix of history, architecture, and panoramic city views. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Jaipur!

Would recommend bringing water and wearing comfortable shoes, especially if you plan to walk around a lot. Overall, a memorable and budget-friendly experience. üëç

places.address: Krishna Nagar, Brahampuri, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001, India

places.generalDescription: Jaigarh Fort, located in Jaipur, was built in the 18th century by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II to protect the Amber Fort complex. The fort spans 3 km in length and 1 km in breadth and offers stunning views of Maota Lake and Amer Fort. It houses temples, residential complexes, and well-preserved water reservoirs. One of its main attractions is the Jaivana Cannon, known as the world's largest cannon on wheels.

sources.snippet: There was a two-kilometer-long secret tunnel constructed in the Amer Fort that led to the Jaigarh Fort, and it was located behind the Zanana Palace. The walls of Jaigarh Fort were said to have been built stronger and more fortified than that of Amer Fort. The tunnel was built to allow the Royal Family to escape to the Jaigarh Fort if Amer Fort was attacked.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort | INDIAN CULTURE

sources.snippet: The Amer Fort/Palace is a beautiful structure that was built by Raja Man Sing in the 16th century. Don't forget to check out the 'Sheesh Mahal', 'Diwan-i-Aam' and 'Sukh Mahal' also. The fort is a ten minute walk uphill and your little trek will be worth the wonders that it offers.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

sources.snippet: A very old tunnel to connect Amber Fort and adjoining Jaigarh Fort is now opened for public along with the electric cab facility for the tourists. Besides, Elephant rides to fort, sound & light shows and cultural evenings have always been a favorite among the visitors.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

sources.snippet: The fort‚Äôs engineering marvel, the ‚ÄòSukh Niwas‚Äô or the Hall of Pleasure, exhibits an innovative cooling system. The walls are designed with a series of water channels that circulated cool water, creating a natural air conditioning effect in the scorching summers.
sources.shortName: Delving into Rajput Grandeur - Amer Fort Travel Guide

sources.snippet: To the North-East of Amer Fort is another prominent structure, the Jaigarh Fort. The Amer Fort, in fact, has a fascinating association with the latter. The two structures were connected by a two-kilometer-long secret tunnel, located behind the Zanana Palace.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

sources.snippet: A secret passage or Surangh is synonymous with almost every Fort in India. Similarly, Amer Fort has one of the trickiest of these secret passages. Running through the Cheel Ka Teela at the basement of the Fort, the passage is two kilometres long.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort History and its Unique Architecture

sources.snippet: Amer tunnel was discovered recently as no one knew about its existence for years. You can walk through the Amer Fort tunnel to Jaigarh Fort. It was an escape route in case of an emergency, especially during a siege.
sources.shortName: The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need

sources.snippet: Both the Jaigarh fort and the Amer fort are considered as one complex due to the secret  passage which was used to escape during the war times by the royal family and also for others in the Amer fort to escape.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

sources.snippet: Raja Kakil Dev ruled over the Amber in 1036 on the site which is currently covered by Jaigarh Fort. Later, it was ruled by Rajput Kings Raja Man Singh I, Raja Jai Singh and his descendants.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort: Amer Fort History | Best Time To Visit | Architecture
Amer | Mughal Architecture, Rajput Palaces & Forts
Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

places.name: Jaigarh Fort

reviews.text: Jaigarh Fort is a must-visit in Jaipur for its grand architecture, stunning views of the Aravalli hills, and rich history. The fort is well-preserved, and the world's largest cannon on wheels is truly impressive. Walking along the massive walls feels like stepping back in time. A perfect spot for history lovers and photographers alike!

I visited Jaigarh Fort recently and really enjoyed it. The fort is huge and gives a great view of the surrounding area. One of the main attractions is the world's biggest cannon on wheels, called "Jaivana Cannon." It's really amazing to see such a massive cannon from so many years ago. The fort feels strong and simple compared to some other forts, but it has its own charm. If you like history and great views, Jaigarh Fort is definitely worth a visit.

If you are a history lover , you should visit this beautiful fort. As you step in you will discover a spot like chilled oasis.  Something magical

, it's a testament to our clever design of our ancestors. The intricate carvings and stunning mirror work will make spellbound . You will love the architect work, how in ancient time people had that much of knowledge to build such beautiful fort.

places.generalDescription: Sheesh Mahal, also known as the Mirror Palace, is a stunning pavilion within Amber Fort that was once used by the imperial family. The palace is renowned for its intricate mirror work, featuring traditional motifs and lotus designs adorning thousands of small mirrors. It is said that even the light from a single candle could illuminate the entire Sheesh Mahal. This historical gem served as the backdrop for iconic scenes in Bollywood films and has become a popular spot for visitors seeking Instagram-worthy photos.

sources.snippet: Built by Raja Sawai Jai Singh II, this gateway gave access to the inner court and the principal apartments of the kings (Jai Mandir or the Sheesh Mahal). The top of the gateway was mounted by a pavilion called Sohag Mandir, the windows of which were used by the royal ladies to watch the ceremonial functions held in the Diwan-i-Aam. The western direction from this entrance led to the Bhojan Shala (dining hall).
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort | INDIAN CULTURE

sources.snippet: Though the fort is quite old and may even look so from the outside, it is beautiful on the inside and boasts of various buildings of prominence like the 'Diwan-i-Aam', the 'Sheesh Mahal' and even the 'Sukh Mahal'. The Amer Fort has influences of both Hindu and Muslim architecture. This fort also has the 'Shila Devi' Temple and the 'Ganesh Pol' which is a gate that leads to the private palaces of the kings.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

sources.snippet: The Sheesh Mahal‚Äôs walls and ceilings are adorned with exquisite floral carvings, glass paintings, and optical illusions. The ‚ÄòSukh Mahal,‚Äô constructed of sandalwood and ivory, is located directly across from the Sheesh Mahal. It has numerous channels with running cold water.
sources.shortName: Jaipur Amer Fort - An Extraordinary Hilltop architectural marvel

sources.snippet: Built in Red sandstone and marble the fort has Diwan-e- Aam, Diwan-i-khas, Sheesh Mahal and Sukh Niwas. Within the  vicinity  of each other there are four courtyards. Amer fort along with Jaigarh fort is located above on the Cheel ka Teela ( Hill of the Eagles).
sources.shortName: Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

sources.snippet: One of them is the palace of mirror Sheesh Mahal and the other one is the palace of pleasure Sukh Mahal. The palace of Raja Man Singh and magic flower fresco also co-exist in this courtyard.
sources.shortName: Explore Jaipur's Iconic Heritage Site

sources.snippet: The reason behind the making of this Sheesh Mahal with glass was during the ancient time queens was not allowed to lie down in open, but she loved to see the stars.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort: Amer Fort History | Best Time To Visit | Architecture
The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

places.name: Sheesh Mahal, Amber Fort

reviews.text:
If you are riding the elephant, be prepared to tip your rider, face thousands of extremely persistent photographers trying to sell you their photographs, if possible just don't take photos if you do not want. The experience because of that is not too good. Luckily we had a guide to shoo them off as much as possible.

Otherwise, the Amber Fort was amazing and the tour guide brought us to every nook and cranny well!! Overall, we spent a good 2 hours here. Should go earlier, otherwise it will be too crowded and extremely hard to take photos!

Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) inside Amber Fort is truly a jewel of Jaipur's royal heritage. The moment you step into this part of the fort, you're greeted by a dazzling sight - walls and ceilings covered in thousands of tiny convex mirrors, intricate glass mosaics, and floral patterns inlaid with precious stones. Even a single candle or ray of sunlight transforms the whole hall into a shimmering galaxy of reflections.

Built during the reign of Maharaja Man Singh in the 16th century and further enhanced by later rulers, Sheesh Mahal was used as a royal reception hall and private chamber for the queens. One of its most fascinating features is its ability to illuminate with minimal light - a single flame could create the effect of a starry night sky, allowing the royals to enjoy beauty and warmth without open flames.

The craftsmanship here is beyond words. Every mirror piece is hand-cut, and every floral motif is painted with natural colors, showing the unmatched skill of artisans from centuries ago. It's not just architecture; it's poetry in glass and stone.

Photography here is an absolute delight, but nothing compares to seeing it with your own eyes - the way light dances across the walls feels almost magical. The area is well-maintained, though due to preservation efforts, some parts are restricted for visitors, which is understandable given its delicate nature.

If you're visiting Amber Fort, Sheesh Mahal is the heart of the experience. Take your time here, look closely at the details, and imagine the royal gatherings, music, and laughter that once filled this sparkling hall.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

It should be the first place on the itinerary if you're planning to visit Jaipur. It will take minimum an hour to explore and if you prefer to click and capture photos along with it. Consider a minimum of 2-3 hours. You might find several points inside the fort of interest and photo friendly.
If you wish to know its history consider a guide otherwise check YouTube plenty of people have described about it before.

places.address: JAIGARH FORT, Devisinghpura, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Hawa Mahal, often referred to as the "Palace of Winds," is a stunning architectural gem located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. Built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh, this five-story palace is renowned for its striking facade adorned with numerous small windows known as jharokhas. These intricately designed openings not only enhance the beauty of the structure but also serve a practical purpose by allowing cool breezes to flow through, making it an early form of natural air conditioning.

sources.shortName: Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

places.name: Hawa Mahal

reviews.text: The experience of being inside the palace was equally enriching. Navigating the winding ramps and staircases, I was able to appreciate the intricate details of the architecture up close. The views of the city from the upper floors are breathtaking, offering a panoramic perspective of Jaipur's vibrant streets and surrounding hills. It's a place that perfectly blends historical significance with stunning beauty. Whether you're a history buff, an architecture enthusiast, or simply looking for a glimpse into India's rich heritage, the Hawa Mahal is an absolute must-visit. It's an unforgettable experience that truly embodies the spirit of Jaipur.

If something in you remembers old stories, quiet dreams, or the simple joy of standing somewhere that has seen centuries pass-Hawa Mahal is made for you. It's not just a monument; it's a breath, a glimpse into royal lives, and a haven of artistry.
I'd recommend going early-beat the heat, catch the gentle light, and let yourself be still for a moment. Let the wind, the pink walls, and the stairs carry you a little away from today and into something tender and timeless.

Hawa Mahal, Jaipur, you have my heart! This stunning monument is an architectural masterpiece, with intricate latticework and beautiful sandstone facades. The moment I stepped inside, I was blown away by the grandeur and history that surrounds you.

The views from the windows are breathtaking ‚Äì a perfect blend of the city's vibrant energy and royal heritage. I loved learning about its fascinating history and significance.

The staff were knowledgeable and friendly, adding to the overall experience. I'd highly recommend visiting Hawa Mahal, especially during sunrise or sunset when the golden light adds to its beauty.

A must-visit for history buffs, architecture enthusiasts, and anyone looking to experience the royal charm of Jaipur. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì Hawa Mahal truly deserves a royal crown! üëëüíñ

places.address: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India

places.generalDescription: Shila Mata Mandir, located within the Amber Fort in Jaipur, is a significant Hindu temple where locals pay their respects to Shila Mata, the Hindu goddess. The fort itself offers stunning sightseeing opportunities and is a popular destination for both local and foreign tourists. Additionally, visitors can enjoy traditional puppet shows performed by Rajasthan citizens. The temple has specific darshan timings and can be reached via stairs, jeep, own vehicle or even an elephant ride.

sources.shortName: The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need

places.name: Shila Mata Mandir Amber Fort

reviews.text:
,,
Maa Shila Mata is a family goddess of  Amber fort kingdom since it was built. A very reknown Mata Durga maa temple and draw a huge crowd during Navratri time to get blessings by devotees..

The Sacred Shila Mata Temple
‚ÄãThe Shila Mata Temple, located within the Amer Fort in Jaipur, is a highly revered shrine dedicated to the goddess Shila Devi. The temple's idol is a unique slab of black stone.  According to legend, the idol was brought by Maharaja Man Singh I from Bengal in the 16th century after a victory against the ruler of Jessore.
‚ÄãThe temple's architecture, primarily built with marble, is a testament to Rajput craftsmanship. The entrance is particularly notable, featuring intricate silver doors adorned with embossed images of deities.  These ornate details create a sense of sanctity and grandeur, making it a key attraction within the fort complex.
‚ÄãThe temple is an important pilgrimage site, drawing devotees and tourists alike who come to witness its historical and spiritual significance. It's a place where faith and history intertwine, offering a glimpse into the religious beliefs and artistic traditions of the Rajput rulers. The temple's presence within a fortress highlights the deep connection between royal power and religious devotion.

Stretching along the hill tops, the first sight of the Amber Fort is beautiful with the lake below it, in the morning light it takes on a hazy glow. Really stunning. Travel up the steep roadway in jeeps and then enter the main parade ground to see majestic elephants strolling round the perimeter. Through into the next huge open space to the hall of mirrors  and the gardens for the audience chamber. As you pass into the next area you move from one timescale into an earlier one which is less opulent and more defensive. You can spend hours there as there is so much to see, and the views from the top are fabulous.

places.address: JAIGARH FORT, Amer Palace, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hill in the Aravalli Range, Amer Fort is an impressive 16th-century fortress and palace located near Jaipur, India. Constructed from marble and red sandstone, this grand structure features four levels, intricate gates, cobbled paths, expansive ramparts, courtyards, a temple, and a 12-kilometer surrounding wall. Notably, it boasts an underground passageway connecting it to Jiagarh Fort for royal family escape during wartime.

sources.snippet: The magnificent Amber Fort, also called Amer Fort, graces the landscape of Jaipur, a prestigious city in Rajasthan, perched atop a hill with stunning views overlooking Maota Lake, showcasing the grandeur of the Rajput era. Built in the 16th century by Raja Man Singh I, the fort combines Rajput and Mughal architectural styles, offering tourists the delightful experience of exploring it on the back of an elephant, adding a touch of royal splendor to their visit.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

sources.snippet: If you live anywhere in South Asia, then it‚Äôs probable that you have heard the word Sheesh Mahal once or many times in your lifetime. If you are unaware as to why is it so popular, let us give you some insights into the subject. Sheesh Mahal or ‚ÄòGlass Palace‚Äô is the favourite and chosen spot for Bollywood shoots in Amer Fort.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort History and its Unique Architecture

sources.snippet: The fort overlooks Maota Lake, which is the principal supply of water for the Amer Palace, from its huge ramparts and system of gates and cobbled roads. The architectural style of various fort structures was heavily inspired by Mughal architecture. Are Amber Palace and Amer Fort the same?
sources.shortName: Jaipur Amer Fort - An Extraordinary Hilltop architectural marvel
Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

places.name: Amer Fort

reviews.text: One of the big fort that is built in Jaipur.. well maintained entry fees is ‚Çπ100 for Indian tourists.. If students are planning to travel plz carry your college ID cards so that u get special concessions your entry fee will be ‚Çπ10 only

One of the best and historical fort in jaipur who is famous for nice and good view in monsoon season. you have to buy tickets for tour.also some off for students if you carrying school/college I'd.
Cons- no hathiyar/aujhaar to see.
Early morning view is must watch. Around 5am with the lights on the beauty of fort is visible in the river running alongside.

places.generalDescription: Jal Mahal, also known as the Water Palace, is a grand red sandstone palace situated in the middle of Man Sagar Lake in Jaipur. Built in the 18th century by Sawai Madho Singh, it was originally intended as a summer resort for the royal family and guests. The palace's unique location makes it one of Jaipur's most famous landmarks.

sources.snippet: Jal Mahal: Situated amidst the tranquil waters of Man Sagar Lake, Jal Mahal is a picturesque palace that appears to float on the surface. Marvel at its exquisite architecture and enjoy the ambience. While entry inside the palace is restricted, you can relish the beauty of this architectural gem from a distance.
sources.shortName: Delving into Rajput Grandeur - Amer Fort Travel Guide
Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips
Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

places.name: Jal Mahal

reviews.text: It's A great place to view click pictures with your friends and family. Spending a good time here. Buy something for home decoration eat street food. Camel üê™ ride most important here. Historic place has great vibes here.

Floating in the middle of Man Sagar Lake, the palace looked magical with its golden fa√ßade reflecting off the calm waters. The atmosphere was quiet and peaceful, giving me plenty of time to take in the view without feeling rushed. While entry inside isn't allowed, just watching the palace from the lakeside, surrounded by hills and birds skimming the water, was memorable. It's a short stop but absolutely worth it for the beauty and tranquility.

As entry isn't allowed, so no tickets. Just spend the time by walking and just seating, chilling and enjoying the beautiful view. A palace in Lake and perk is it's green mount background. Away from high rise building, only you and nature.
Management should work over cleanliness here.

places.generalDescription: Ganesh Pol serves as the stunning entrance to the expansive Amber Palace complex, a true gem in Jaipur. Adorned with intricate paintings of Lord Ganesh, this ornate gateway leads visitors into a world of royal splendor. Inside, you'll find the Diwan-e-Am hall featuring beautifully carved columns and latticed galleries, along with the king's private quarters and other remarkable structures like Jai Mandir or Sheesh Mahal.

sources.snippet: The magnificent Ganesh Pol is the gateway to three pleasure palaces, each with special features, built around a Mughal-style garden, Aram Bagh. Maota Lake, which provided water to the fort, is surrounded by two exquisite gardens. The Kesar Kyari Bagh has start-shaped flower beds once planted with saffron, flowers, while Dilaram Bagh, built in 1568 as a resting place for Akbar on his way to Ajmer, is a clever pun on the name of its architect, Dilaram.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

sources.snippet: The other two essential gateways of the fort were Singhpol and Ganeshpol. The royal palaces were accessed through a double gateway called the Singhpol or the Lion Gate. A huge flight of steps leads to the gate, which made the journey to the fort more laborious.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort | INDIAN CULTURE

sources.snippet: Ganesh Pol is the main entrance to the personal quarter of kings and queens in the old days. Only important people were allowed entry beyond this gate. It is incredibly beautiful and is one of the most photographed locations in Amer Fort.
sources.shortName: The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need

sources.snippet: This fort also has the 'Shila Devi' Temple and the 'Ganesh Pol' which is a gate that leads to the private palaces of the kings. The Amer Fort has many pavilions and halls of great interest and other popular attractions.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

sources.snippet: The Ganesh Pol or the Ganesh Gate is the entrance to the third courtyard. The Ganesh Gate is decorated with mosaics and sculptures which give a grand look. The gardens in the fort show us the Mughal architecture.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

sources.snippet: The other two essential gateways of the fort were Singhpol and Ganeshpol. The royal palaces were accessed through the Singhpol which was a double gateway. This gate opened out into the Diwan-i-Aam.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

sources.snippet: As one approaches the fort, they are greeted by the imposing Ganesh Pol, a magnificent gateway adorned with beautiful frescoes and intricate detailing.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort | Jaipur - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

places.name: Ganesh Pol

reviews.text: Beautiful place. Must visit spot is sheesh mehal. Also get a guide, the history is very interesting

Part of the open space courtyard grounds and one of the main entrances to the palace area.  Get a picture in one the cubby areas as they are quite ornate.  Do a tour and you will see all these area along the way
Beautiful place, must visit if you are in Jaipur. Has beautiful architecture and heritage.

places.address: JAIGARH FORT, Amer Road, Devisinghpura, Amer, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Jaleb Chowk is a significant part of the Amer Fort palace facility in Jaipur, India. It is the main courtyard where returning armies used to display their plunder to the people. The courtyard has witnessed many war outcomes and reflects both joys and sorrows. Built by Sawai Jai Singh, it serves as an assembly place for soldiers and holds historical significance. The fort also includes sections such as the Kings quarters, zenana, gardens, temples, and more.

sources.snippet: The gate leads into a huge courtyard, Jaleb Chowk, lined on three sides with souvenir and refreshment shops. A flight of steps leads to the Shila Devi Temple, which has silver doors; silver oil lamps, grand pillars carved to look like banana trees, and contain the Kachhawaha family deity, a stone image of the goddess Kali. The next courtyard is the Diwan-i-Aam, the space for public audience.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

sources.snippet: The 'Jaleb Chowk' is one of the four courtyards of the Amer Palace. The 'Sila Devi' Temple is right at the entrance to the main palace grounds. The second courtyard is famous for its 'Diwan-i-Aam' (Public Audience Hall), the 'Sheesh Mahal' and the 'Sukh Mahal'.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

sources.snippet: The lower terrace of the palace was surrounded by a huge courtyard - Jaleb Chowk which was used by the Royal Army for parades. The Chowk was further surrounded by blocks of buildings. The other two essential gateways of the fort were Singhpol and Ganeshpol.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

sources.snippet: Offline: If you are opting for offline purchase, then, the ticket counter will be available in Jaleb Chowk courtyard opposite to Suraj Pol. From here you can purchase the tickets for the fort and also, can hire a local guide or an audio guide.
sources.shortName: Explore Jaipur's Iconic Heritage Site
The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need

places.name: Jaleb Chowk

reviews.text: 'Jaleb Chowk' is a common term used for any open ground that was earlier used for public gatherings when the reigning king wished to address his kingdom. An open space that served as an assembly ground for soldiers, Jalebi Chowk is the first stop in Amer Fort complex, if one entered from the Surajpol gate. Back in the day, this ground was surrounded by horse stables.

Jaleb Chowk is an¬†Arabic¬†phrase meaning a place for soldiers to assemble.
This is first of the four courtyards of Amer Palace, built during Sawai Jai Singh's reign (1693‚Äì1743).
In this large courtyard, soldiers would hold victory parades upon their return from battle.
This would be witnessed by the royals & the women through latticed windows.
Suraj Pol & Chand Pol leads into this courtyard.
A staircase to the right, leads to the Shila Devi temple.
Another set of stairs leads to the upper second courtyard of Diwani- i -am & Ganesh Pol.
Soldiers lived in the quarters of the Jaleb Chowk.
I loveed this place, too many foreign people visit here .

places.address: XRMV+9VC, Jaigarh Rd, Devisinghpura, Amer, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: The Amber Fort Light and Sound Show offers a captivating journey through the 600-year-old Royal Amber Fort's history. This cultural spectacle combines sound, music, light, and folklore narratives to bring the monument to life. The colorful lights illuminate the fort and shimmer on Maota Lake, creating a truly mesmerizing experience for visitors. Narrated by Bollywood superstar Mr. Amitabh Bachchan, this show is available in both Hindi and English, making it an essential part of Jaipur's heritage tourism.

sources.snippet: Amongst the numerous forts in Rajasthan, Amer Fort is said to be one of the best. It epitomizes the Giri Parshva Durga style. This style is considered unique because the fortifications and civilian structures extend down the hill slope of the fort and are not just limited to the summit.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort | INDIAN CULTURE

sources.snippet: If you love exploring the history of Amer Fort, don‚Äôt miss the Amer Light and Sound Show which takes place every evening near Kesar Kyari in Maota Lake, Amer. This show runs in two editions ‚Äì Hindi and English. The cost of the Amer Fort light and sound show is around Rs 300.
sources.shortName: The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need

sources.snippet: Besides being hailed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Amer Fort of Jaipur in Rajasthan boasts pristine architecture and a stark history like no other.
sources.shortName: Explore Jaipur's Iconic Heritage Site

sources.snippet: Amer or Amber fort is located on a top of a hill near Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. It is located in Amer town which is 11 kilometers from Jaipur
sources.shortName: Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

places.name: Amber Fort Light and Sound Show

reviews.text:
Buy tickets in advance... we hired a guide and that was the best decision (got a personal photographer in him üòã)
Kids enjoyed the Puppet show as well.

Light and sound show was really nice but not for kids as there were no visuals for kids only the lights and sounds..

The sound effect is nice, but the lighting part of the show is a bit outdated and out of sync. The story itself is also below par. It has no fluency and goes off in different trajectories. It's an okay story for people completely unfamiliar with Indian history, but that's about it.
The walk from parking to the light and sound show is pleasant. The open-air atmosphere is pleasant and can be a nice experience overall. But I wouldn't recommend expecting much from the show itself.

If you are visiting Jaipur, try and make time to visit the light and sound show. It's basically a very interesting 50-minute audio show of the 1000-year history of the Amer fort. Various parts of the fort are illuminated as the story is told and the sky darkens.

places.address: XVM2+PWV, Devisinghpura, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Shri Jagat Shiromani ji Temple, located in Amer Town, Jaipur, is a 17th-century Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Krishna. The temple's construction showcases a blend of Hindu, Jain, and South Indian architectural styles using granite, sandstone, and marble. Built by Rani Kankabati in memory of her son Maharaja Kumar Jagat Singhji, the temple exudes spiritual aura and faith.

sources.shortName: The Only Travel Guide You Will Ever Need
Amer Fort Jaipur | Amber Fort

places.name: Shri Jagat Shiromani ji Temple ( Meera mandir )

reviews.text:
We discovered Sri Jagat Shiromani Temple in Amber by simply surrendering the map and following the flow of the day. As the sun set, we wandered into this beautiful mandir and were welcomed by local children, the priest, and the temple keepers. The energy here was profound,  it resonated with a mother's love.

The temple itself was built in the early 1600s by Queen Kanakavati in memory of her son Jagat Singh. Dedicated to Krishna, Vishnu, and Meera Bai, it feels both intimate and timeless. The stone artistry is absolutely breathtaking, with carved details that seem alive in the evening light.

This temple resonates with the soul of place, a place to sink into and feel with your heart as you connect to all. One of the most meaningful discoveries of our Amber walk.

The spiritual energy of this temple cannot be described in words.
The beauty of it and around it is truly mesmerizing.
The architecture of this temple is amazing.
This temple is dedicated to  Meera Bai and Lord Krishna.
It has a grand entryway with big elephant sculptures.
I love spending my time in the evening here.

ùó¶ùóµùóøùó∂ ùóùùóÆùó¥ùóÆùòÅ ùó¶ùóµùó∂ùóøùóºùó∫ùóÆùóªùó∂ ùóßùó≤ùó∫ùóΩùóπùó≤ | (1)
Shri Jagat Shiromani Temple in Amer, Jaipur, is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Krishna and Vishnu. Built between 1599 and 1608 AD by Queen Kanakwati in memory of her son Jagat Singh, the temple holds historical and spiritual significance. It houses the same idol of Lord Krishna worshiped by Meera Bai, a devoted saint and poet, over 600 years ago. This idol was saved from destruction during the Mughal war with Mewar state and later brought to Amer.

What makes this temple unique is that it is the only one in the world where idols of Lord Krishna and Meera Bai are worshiped together. Meera Bai considered Lord Krishna her spiritual husband, and the temple reflects their special bond. With its rich history and spiritual value, the Jagat Shiromani Temple is a monument of national importance and an essential part of Amer's heritage.

The Jagat Shiromani Temple is a masterpiece of Rajasthani architecture, with intricate carvings and stunning designs that transport you to a world of divine beauty. Its majestic structure, adorned with sculptures of trumpeting elephants and horses, seems to come alive with stories from mythological texts. The temple's strategic location on a small hill adds to its grandeur, making it a breathtaking sight to behold. As you step inside, the serene atmosphere and exquisite craftsmanship will leave you spellbound, making it a must-visit destination for anyone who appreciates art, history, and spirituality.

places.address: XVQ2+JGC, 6, Sagar Rd, Devisinghpura, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Maotha Lake, nestled in the heart of Jaipur city, is a serene retreat surrounded by verdant hills. This picturesque oasis was once the primary water source for the renowned Amer Fort and played a crucial role in the region's history. The tranquil waters of Maotha Lake offer an ideal setting for relaxation and leisurely activities such as swimming. Visitors can also admire the reflection of the nearby Amber Palace on the lake's surface, creating a captivating sight.

sources.snippet: The Amer Fort was built in red sandstone and marble and the Maotha Lake adds a certain charm to the entire Fort. Though the fort is quite old and may even look so from the outside, it is beautiful on the inside and boasts of various buildings of prominence like the 'Diwan-i-Aam', the 'Sheesh Mahal' and even the 'Sukh Mahal'. The Amer Fort has influences of both Hindu and Muslim architecture.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort - History, Architecture, Visiting Hours

places.name: Maotha Lake

reviews.text:
Maota Lake, Amer Fort: A Serene Escape

Breathtaking Views
Maota Lake offers stunning views of Amer Fort against a backdrop of lush hills. It's a peaceful spot to relax and take photos, especially at sunrise or sunset. A perfect complement to your visit to the fort!

Tranquil Atmosphere
The serene ambiance of Maota Lake is a welcome contrast to the bustling fort. The gentle sound of water and the sight of colorful boats make it a lovely place to unwind. Highly recommended for a moment of reflection.

Great for Photos
This lake provides some of the best photo opportunities in Jaipur. The reflections of the fort on the water are simply magical. Make sure to bring your camera!

A Historical Gem
The lake is not just beautiful; it's steeped in history as well. The connection between Maota Lake and Amer Fort adds depth to your visit. Take some time to learn about its significance.

Perfect for a Stroll
Walking around Maota Lake is a delightful experience. The pathways are well-maintained, and you can enjoy the views while soaking in the history of the area. A must-visit when exploring Amer Fort!

A seasonal lake in Amer location near by Dilaram garden on the top Shiladevi Temple and Amer palace.
In rainy season one can enjoy the ride of üö¢ Boat.
In the middle of lake a tiny island wherein a temple situated.
Many religious and cultural activities performed here.. Mundan, After marriage pair visit, after birth of children ceremony etc.
Main attraction of tourism.
But lack of cleanliness and security hurts ü§ï.

A rich historical place with a lake ... Which will be perfect background for your pictures. In day time there will be rush to try weekdays to visit. After 8pm it will be quite empty but visit with safety concern. But in night time - it will be perfect place to bring your love one.

places.generalDescription: Nestled just outside the majestic Amer Fort, Kesar Kyari is a stunning Mughal garden that enchants visitors with its historical charm and picturesque views. This manmade island in Maota Lake features star-shaped flower beds that were once adorned with saffron blooms, reflecting the rich heritage of both Mughal and Rajasthani architecture.

sources.snippet: The Amer Fort is not just splendid from the inside but offers an extraordinary view from its balconies too. One of such views is the breathtaking vision of the historic Kesar Kayari, a Mughal garden built on a manmade island in Maota Lake. According to the landscape architect Tom Turner, there was a pulley system, especially for the women, that connected directly with the Amer fort and reduced the male interaction with women.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort History and its Unique Architecture

sources.snippet: The Kesar Kyari Bagh has start-shaped flower beds once planted with saffron, flowers, while Dilaram Bagh, built in 1568 as a resting place for Akbar on his way to Ajmer, is a clever pun on the name of its architect, Dilaram. A small archeological Museum is located nearby. The farthest and oldest end of the fort was converted into the zenana, with screens and covered balconies for the seclusion of the royal ladies in purdah.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort ‚Äì The Saga of Magnificent Architecture and Culture

sources.snippet: Light & Sound Show ‚Äì The evening Light & Sound show is the major attraction of the Amer Fort which tells the story of the Rajput kings, their imperial lifestyle and about their wars held at Kesar Kyari. This grandiose show was narrated by Megastar of Bollywood Mr Amitabh Bachchan in English and Hindi both.
sources.shortName: Amer Fort: Amer Fort History | Best Time To Visit | Architecture

sources.snippet: It contains an island at the center named the Kesar Kyari Bagh. The island has a saffron garden, believed to have been built in the 15th century. It is believed that the lake was perhaps the major source of water for the inhabitants of the fort.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

sources.snippet: It contains an island in the center named, Kesar Kyari Bagh. The island has a saffron garden, believed to have been built in the 15th century. Maota Lake was the major source of water for the Royal Family in the Amer Fort.

places.generalDescription: Chand Pol (Moon Gate) is one of the entrances to Amer Fort, leading into the main courtyard known as Jaleb Chowk. In ancient times, returning armies would showcase their spoils here. The fort comprises various sections such as the King's quarters, zenana (residence for women), gardens, and temples. This gate was specifically constructed for common people to enter the Amer Palace.

sources.snippet: Strengthened with several gates, the fort had two important entrances- one from Dalaram‚Äôs garden - Suraj Pol (facing the sun) and the other from the town side - Chand Pol (facing the moon). The lower terrace of the palace was surrounded by a huge courtyard - Jaleb Chowk which was used by the Royal Army for parades and all their military action. The Chowk was further surrounded by blocks of buildings.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort | INDIAN CULTURE

sources.snippet: Strengthened with several gates, the fort had two important entrances- one from Dalaram‚Äôs garden - Suraj Pol and the other from the town side - Chand Pol. The lower terrace of the palace was surrounded by a huge courtyard - Jaleb Chowk which was used by the Royal Army for parades. The Chowk was further surrounded by blocks of buildings.
sources.shortName: The Awe-Inspiring Amer Fort

places.name: Chand Pol (Moon Gate)

reviews.text: Chand Pol (Moon Gate) in Jaipur, India, is a breathtaking entrance to the city's enchanting old quarter. The intricately designed gate, adorned with traditional motifs, reflects the city's rich cultural heritage. Stepping through its archway feels like stepping into history, where the past and present seamlessly merge. Chand Pol stands as a captivating reminder of Jaipur's royal legacy and architectural finesse. As the gateway beckons travelers to explore the vibrant lanes beyond, it offers a glimpse into the city's soul and a journey back in time.
Gate for the citizens of Amber , the common peoples used the moon gate to enter the mahal
Part of the gates of the Fort/palace.  Do the tour as you will walk through all of these areas.  General courtyard this leads to and on the walls you will see see some great views
